SENT.plain: INTRODUCTION: Osler-Rendu-Weber syndrome is an inherited disorder characterized by mucocutaneous and visceral telangiectasia
It is often revealed by recurrent epistaxis
It is sometimes profuse and intractable
CASE STUDY: A 61-year-old male patient presented with severe epistaxis due to Osler-Rendu-Weber syndrome
Embolization of the external carotid branches was needed for hemostasis
DISCUSSION: Embolization of external carotid artery branches can be an effective therapeutic alternative when usual treatments fail
